sub_title: Trainer & E-Learning Consultant | Exhibitions & Installations | Professional ARTlete
summary:
For the past 20 years I have navigated all the spheres of communications-related occupations in the media, education, fashion, art and cultural sectors. 

I hold an MA in Critical Fashion Practices, a BA in Multimedia and a Postgrad Diploma in Marketing Management. Even though these fields seem unrelated, they all focus on how people communicate and interact, what their values are and how they show affiliation. Regardless of the industry, as long as my work is people-focused, I thrive. 

I have worked in South Africa, Botswana, China, Japan and the Netherlands. After 2 decades I have built up a myriad of skills, starting with content creation then moving to optimisation and dissemination of content. I later started managing large projects as well as training and coaching children and adults in the classroom and online. This broad exposure has enabled me to acquire a wide range of practical, teaching, intercultural and decision-making skills that serves the role of Facilitator and Project Manager well. The following outlines the main principles that guide my coaching and management styles.

Have a system: Whether drafting strategic and project plans with various stakeholders or developing a curriculum is important to be detailed, concise and relay conceptual theory in easy-to-digest chunks.

Communicate:  It’s good to have frequent and open communication on what goals need to be accomplished and what milestones to reach to accomplish these goals. Coworkers and learners need to feel safe, confident and supported to achieve success.

Be responsive: The zeitgeist is forever changing. Whether it is transferring skills for a 360 turnkey project or transferring skills to leaners I encourage myself and others to not get stuck on legacy issues or be averse to learning new concepts and behaviours. 

Invite co-creation: Collect all the voices and elicit user participation in everything from institutional plans to brand identity. Centre the content strategies around the people that are using the content.

Empower them: People from diverse backgrounds are participating in the globalized world. My philosophy is to imbue everyone with agency and respect by investing in succession planning and making sure that responsibility is distributed.

Focus on the future: I help people cultivate a deeper understanding of the inter-and intra-connectedness between the self, other people, nature, things, space, and time. This style of exploration will hopefully motivate and inspire humanity to play an active role in tackling societal issues.

school.name: ESMOD École Supérieure des Arts et techniques de la Mode
University of South Africa/Universiteit van Suid-Afrika

profile_positions.description:
-Supported business professionals working for big tech or global brands (Mercari, LINE, Anpad, Patagonia) to augment inter-cultural and English language competencies in order to conduct business internationally. 

-Demonstrated strong ability to incorporate various concepts and coaching strategies into cohesive learner centered lessons.

-Mentored MBA students at UCLA and Harvard Business Schools in developing vocabulary and communication strategies to convincingly present their business proposals.

Main duties: Learner Led-Online Training | Task Based Education | Instructional Design | Assessment and Coaching | Professional Development | International Communications & Presentation
profile_positions.title: Trainer & Coach

profile_positions.description:
For my thesis, I developed a series of workshops titled: #ARTletics (a neologism of art and athletics)

The workshops, positioned at the intersection of embodiment and critical theory, rely on movement and somatic practices to activate affect. 

I emphasize the role of lived and embodied experiences in my workshops and support participants in shifting their perspective from human autonomy and towards acknowledging their entanglement with an agentic world. 

Moving and participating activates one’s most instinctive sensations which results in a self-reflexive, subjective and engaging way of parsing the world. 

Questioning the traditional boundaries between the body and the garments will hopefully assist in  establishing a more responsible relationship with our clothes.
profile_positions.title: Critical Fashion Practitioner

profile_positions.description: I was a member of the ArtEZ Academy Council for the Master's Program and assisted with promoting openness, public access, and mutual consultation with the university as well as helped draw up internal regulations.
profile_positions.title: Masters Academy Councils

profile_positions.description:
As co-curator for the Clean Clothes Campaign (Schone Kleren Campagne, SKC),  we designed an interactive exhibition to advocate for public awareness around the importance of freedom of association and wage issues in the garment industry. 

We brainstormed ways to evoke civic interest in traceability and making the manufacturing process more transparent.

We did the main research, wrote the copy and developed the prototype for the exhibition.
profile_positions.title: Curator

profile_positions.description:
- As a tour and experience coordinator, I took clients on customised bicycle tours through the city of Kyoto, and shared my extensive knowledge on Japanese history and culture with them. 

- The whole team was passionate about our jobs and between the owner and 2 guides, we grew into the number 7 outdoor activity in Kyoto. Read our great reviews on TripAdvisor.
profile_positions.title: Tour and Experience Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
-Doshisha International Academy is the primary and secondary school connected with Doshisha University in Kyoto.

-Followed the IB trans-disciplinary approach to teach grade 3,4,5, & 6 learners how to develop an understanding of and appreciation for research, communication and critical theory. 

-Concrete and abstract concepts were communicated to students in creative ways while also cultivating creativity. 

-As the primary teacher I developed and executed a PYP curriculum.  I applied instructional design theory to develop manuals and textbooks.

-Taught a variety of art styles using knowledge of art history and different art genres. Students interacted with each other in an international environment to develop cultural understanding and awareness.
profile_positions.title: PYP Art Educator

profile_positions.description:
-Based on insights from robust data collection, developed a blended e-learning training course (videos & podcasts) to learn Mandarin.

-Successfully implemented Customer Data Platform which intuitively adapted the curriculum and user interface to optimally accommodate students on their learning journey.

-Created a holistic paid acquisition strategy, ultimately leading to an ROI of 23% for every dollar spent.

-Formed strategic partnerships and collaborated with language and culture experts to generate high-quality content which prompted consistent organic revenue growth of 5% a month.

-Oversaw a team of 3 in-house employees, 15 external bloggers and 90 affiliates.

Main duties:  Knowledge Brokering | Project Management | Risk & Cost Management | Critical Thinking | Relationship Building | Reputation Monitoring |  SEM/SEO | Email/Affiliate/Social Media Marketing | Analytics | Writing  | Content Creation | Evergage 1-to-1 Customization.
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
-Promoted grassroots internationalization & cultural exchange at elementary, junior and senior-high school levels.  

-Improved classroom participation through imaginative role-playing exercises, while simultaneously reinforcing the topic material.

-Taught lessons encompassing a range of skill-building activities for speaking, writing, reading and listening.

-Evaluated and revised lesson plans and course contents to facilitate and moderate classroom discussions and student-centered learning.

-Kept students on task with proactive behavior modification and positive reinforcement strategies.

Main duties:  Classroom management | Target-Language Acquisition & Communication | Didactic C & Pedagogic Frameworks | Collaboration and Teamwork | Assessment & Testing
profile_positions.title: ESL and Intercultural Educator

profile_positions.description:
-As the custodian of the SABCNews.com website I worked cross-functionally between the TV, radio and digital units to develop innovative tech which would enable access to news and current affairs content. 

-Worked on 360 turnkey projects as part of the conceptualization, implementation and maintenance phases using Agile Project Management and SCRUM. 

-Met strict deadlines and ensured the transfer of skills from the project team to the end users took place.

-I actively cooperated with the, Mandela Foundation, Google Africa, the Independent Electoral Commission, Reuters and FIFA. 

Main duties: Project Lifectcle Management | Agile | Scrum | Stakeholder Relations | Critical Thinking | Relationship Building | Complex Communication | Web-Development | SEM/SEO | Business Analysis | Writing | Audio/Video/Graphic Content Creation.
profile_positions.title: Multimedia Specialist

profile_positions.description:
This was a great opportunity to support a team of business consultants on a change management project for the WUC (Water Utilities Company) and LEA (Local Enterprise Authority) in Botswana.

I co-ordinated administrative functions between the team and stakeholders, managed office, travel reservations and the expenses budget.

It was important to maintain good relationships with the vendors and sales providers. It was critical to manage the expectations of an international team and make sure everyone was comfortable.

In addition to the management and administrative function I did a lot of design and DTP work, like corporate letterheads, presentations and maintaining the corporate identity and website.
profile_positions.title: Special Project Coordinator

skills: Teaching English as a Foreign Language
